metadata.Title: CVE-2020-26953 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
It was possible to cause the browser to enter fullscreen mode withoutdisplaying the security UI; thus making it possible to attempt a phishingattack or otherwise confuse the user. This vulnerability affects Firefox <83, Firefox ESR < 78.5, and Thunderbird < 78.5.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-26953` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 83.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
firefox-geckodriver - 83.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
firefox-mozsymbols - 83.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:78.8.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:78.8.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:78.8.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:78.8.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:78.8.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:78.8.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '83.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.2').
thunderbird package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:78.8.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
mozjs38 package in esm-apps/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs52 package in esm-infra/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
